abstract: Editorial asserts that the legal profession is still resistant to putting women in leadership positions, even though 30 years ago Supreme Court Justice Sandra Day O'Connor heard her first cases on the court; argues that law firms should understand that the profession will continue to lose talented lawyers unless they retain a higher share of women.
snippet: Unless the legal profession figures out ways to retain more women, it will continue to lose talented lawyers.
lead_paragraph: Unless the legal profession figures out ways to retain more women, it will continue to lose talented lawyers.
